fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Business and Industry, Taxation, Single market, Regional Policy, Trans-European Networks, Transport
eu_initiatives: The Irish economy has been transformed since EU membership. Ireland's national legislative process has also been affected by EU membership and the expansion of competencies. In this context, Dublin Chamber is focused on issues that are of national interest as they are affected by policy developments in the European Commission, Council, and Parliament.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: Dublin Chamber is the largest chamber of commerce in Ireland, with a multi-sector membership base of 1,300 companies, spanning the spectrum from start-ups to multinationals. It is the most representative and broadly-based business group in the Greater Dublin Area, providing representation, networking, and a range of business support services. Its policy work focuses on developing the region's infrastructure and transport offering, promoting competitiveness, and improving local governance. Dublin Chamber is also one of the oldest chambers of commerce in the world, tracing its origins back to 1782.
relevant_communication: Dublin Chamber briefs members through events and publications on relevant policy issues including developments at EU level. The Chamber engages with the EU Institutions through formal consultations and meetings with officials as necessary.
